conclusion: The magnetic flux linked with the part of the loop that is inside the field equals Φ = (B · ½L²).
The field is directed into the page and is decreasing uniformly at the rate k = –dB/dt.

premise: The magnetic flux linked with the part of the loop that is inside the field equals Φ = (B · ½L²). The field is directed into the page and is decreasing uniformly at the rate k = –dB/dt.

conclusion: The induced emf around the whole loop is |ε| = |–dΦ/dt| = ½kL².
The loop is broken by an ideal capacitor C, therefore no steady conduction path exists.

premise: The loop is broken by an ideal capacitor C, therefore no steady conduction path exists.
conclusion: Charge is displaced and the capacitor becomes charged until the potential difference across it equals the induced emf.
The instantaneous current i obeys i = C (dV/dt), but V = ε, so i = C (dε/dt).

premise: ε = ½kL² is constant in time (k is constant), dε/dt = 0.
